function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Influenza virus survival prediction may be inaccurate due to different models and variable parameters.","Impact":"Inaccurate predictions may lead to ineffective control measures and increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Standardize modeling parameters and consider the use of advanced predictive models to improve accuracy.","Technologies":"Advanced predictive modeling, standardization of modeling parameters.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Inconsistencies in the impact of RH, temperature, and AH on virus survival may lead to misinterpretation of risk factors.","Impact":"Misinterpretation may lead to ineffective control strategies and increased risk of disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to clarify the impact of RH, temperature, and AH on virus survival. Consider using interaction terms in modeling to capture complex relationships.","Technologies":"Advanced statistical modeling, data analysis techniques.","People":"Research scientists, epidemiologists.","Owner":"Research institutions, academic institutions."},{"Description":"Caution against drawing conclusions about virus survival under real-world conditions based on laboratory-based studies.","Impact":"Use of inaccurate findings to inform real-world conditions may result in inappropriate public health interventions and increased disease transmission risk.","Mitigation":"Conduct studies that closely mimic real-world conditions, validate laboratory findings with real-world data, and consider epidemiological evidence.","Technologies":"Real-world simulation models, validation methods for laboratory studies.","People":"Public health officials, policymakers, researchers.","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions."}]}
